Description: Sherd of pottery slim amphora; incised lines; (a) frieze of dancing satyrs with horses hoofs pursuing a maenad; (b) similar design; below is a frieze of sirens; joined to another sherd.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: reconstructed with BM GR 1888,0208.75a Findspot number '29' is pencilled on the item
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B114)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 583, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD115)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
